segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

translations.ja: みなさん、こんにちは！

segments.source_content: Another busy week with lots of releases 🤪 Hydrogen 1.0, Fresh 1.0, Next.js 12.2, React-Native 0.69...

translations.ja: 今週もリリースが盛りだくさんの忙しい週でした 🤪 Hydrogen 1.0、Fresh 1.0、Next.js 12.2、React-Native 0.69...

segments.source_content: I liked Josh Comeau's article on MDX-based emailing: this is exactly the setup I want to adopt for this newsletter 👌.

translations.ja: Josh ComeauのMDXベースのメール作成に関する記事が気に入りました。このニュースレターでまさに採用したいセットアップです 👌。

segments.source_content: Speaking of this newsletter, I'm still looking for a solution to make the content more "digestible". What do you think about the idea of a daily newsletter? That means a more frequent email, but also a much shorter one.

translations.ja: このニュースレターについてですが、コンテンツをもっと「消化しやすい」ものにするための解決策をまだ探しています。日刊ニュースレターというアイデアについてどう思いますか？より頻繁に送信する代わりに、各メールを大幅に短くするというものです。

segments.source_content: ## React

translations.ja: ## React

segments.source_content: [Fresh 1.0](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-is-stable?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [Fresh 1.0](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-is-stable?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: The Preact framework officially supported by Deno is now v1 and considered production-ready. Fresh reminds me of a mix between Remix and Astro: no JS by default, progressive enhancement, multi-page app with islands architecture. There is no build step: you deploy directly your TypeScript/Deno app to the Edge in a few seconds.

translations.ja: Deno公式サポートのPreactフレームワークがv1となり、本番環境対応と見なされました。FreshはRemixとAstroのミックスのような印象です：デフォルトでJSなし、プログレッシブエンハンスメント、アイランドアーキテクチャを採用したマルチページアプリです。ビルドステップがなく、TypeScript/Denoアプリを数秒でEdgeに直接デプロイできます。

segments.source_content: [How We Built Hydrogen](https://shopify.engineering/how-we-built-hydrogen?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [How We Built Hydrogen](https://shopify.engineering/how-we-built-hydrogen?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Hydrogen, Shopify's React meta-framework for building e-commerce stores, just went v1.0 and was one of the first to rely on React Server Components. This article is an interesting feedback on the creation of the framework, detailing various choices made over time: React Server Components, Vite, Tailwind, preloading/waterfall, GraphQL fragments...

translations.ja: Shopifyのeコマースストア構築用ReactメタフレームワークであるHydrogenがv1.0となり、React Server Componentsを最初に採用したフレームワークの1つです。この記事はフレームワーク作成に関する興味深いフィードバックで、React Server Components、Vite、Tailwind、プリロード/ウォーターフォール、GraphQLフラグメントなど、時間をかけて行われた様々な選択について詳しく説明しています...

segments.source_content: [Next.js 12.2](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-12-2?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [Next.js 12.2](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-12-2?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Latest version of Next.js. The main theme is the gradual adoption of the Edge and standardized web APIs: middleware, but also API routes and SSR. There are also improvements on images, and a system of SWC plugins in WebAssembly.

translations.ja: Next.jsの最新バージョンです。主なテーマはEdgeと標準化されたWeb APIの段階的な採用です：ミドルウェアだけでなく、APIルートとSSRも対象です。画像に関する改善や、WebAssemblyでのSWCプラグインシステムも含まれています。

segments.source_content: [My Wonderful HTML Email Workflow](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/react/wonderful-emails-with-mjml-and-mdx/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [素晴らしいHTMLメールのワークフロー](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/react/wonderful-emails-with-mjml-and-mdx/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Josh Comeau explains how he writes his emails with MDX, then uses MJML, React and Next.js to create the final HTML output that will work in all email clients, sent through ConvertKit, and will also be available on the web.

translations.ja: Josh Comeauが、MDXを使ってメールを作成し、MJML、React、Next.jsを活用して全てのメールクライアントで動作する最終的なHTML出力を生成し、ConvertKit経由で送信し、ウェブ上でも利用可能にする方法を解説しています。

segments.source_content: [Data Flow in Remix](https://remix.run/blog/remix-data-flow?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [Remixにおけるデータフロー](https://remix.run/blog/remix-data-flow?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: The initial model of React can be summarized as `ui = f(state)`. The problem is that this model does not really take into account network synchronization (i.e. API calls). Jim explains how Remix takes the React model and includes the network, thus reducing the need for local state management.

translations.ja: Reactの初期モデルは`ui = f(state)`と要約できます。しかし、このモデルはネットワーク同期（つまりAPI呼び出し）を十分に考慮していません。Jimは、RemixがReactモデルを取り入れつつネットワークを組み込むことで、ローカル状態管理の必要性を減らす方法を説明しています。

segments.source_content: [You Might Not Need an Effect](https://beta.reactjs.org/learn/you-might-not-need-an-effect?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [Effectが必要ないかもしれない](https://beta.reactjs.org/learn/you-might-not-need-an-effect?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: New doc page written by Dan Abramov, just merged to the beta site. Effects exist for synchronization with an external system. Many anti-patterns are presented with concrete examples and even challenges. Even experienced devs should read it. Some things may surprise: like [using setState while rendering](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1541793224561463297?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) 😱. I particularly liked the `useSyncExternalStore` example.

translations.ja: Dan Abramovによって書かれた新しいドキュメントページがベータサイトにマージされました。Effectは外部システムとの同期のために存在します。多くのアンチパターンが具体的な例と課題と共に紹介されています。経験豊富な開発者でも読む価値があり、[レンダリング中のsetStateの使用](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1541793224561463297?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)のような驚くべき内容も含まれています。特に`useSyncExternalStore`の例が気に入りました。

segments.source_content: [What is the recommended way to load data for React 18?](https://www.reddit.com/r/reactjs/comments/vi6q6f/what_is_the_recommended_way_to_load_data_for/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [React 18でデータをロードする推奨方法は？](https://www.reddit.com/r/reactjs/comments/vi6q6f/what_is_the_recommended_way_to_load_data_for/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Dan Abramov explains on Reddit why data fetching via useEffect is not ideal. However, there is no need to rewrite your application on the spot if it doesn't have any UX issue: those problems are not new in React 18, just better documented. See also comments on React-Native data-fetching.

translations.ja: Dan AbramovがRedditで、useEffectを使ったデータ取得が理想的でない理由を説明しています。ただし、UXに問題がないアプリケーションをすぐに書き直す必要はありません。これらの問題はReact 18で新たに発生したものではなく、より詳細に文書化されただけです。React-Nativeのデータ取得に関するコメントも参照してください。

translations.ja: [**Storetasker: フリーランスShopify開発者ネットワーク**](https://www.storetasker.com/become-an-expert?utm_campaign=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=thisweekinreact\&utm_source=thisweekinreact)

segments.source_content: Hey! This is Tim from Storetasker. We run the best Shopify dev freelance network. I would love for you to apply if you enjoy building Shopify sites or are excited about leveraging Shopify's **cutting-edge React framework** for building custom storefronts: [**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

translations.ja: こんにちは！StoretaskerのTimです。私たちは最高のShopify開発フリーランスネットワークを運営しています。Shopifyサイトの構築が好きな方や、カスタムストアフロント構築のためのShopifyの**最先端Reactフレームワーク**である[**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)を活用することに興味がある方は、ぜひ応募してください。

segments.source_content: Accepted devs on the network work on a freelance basis, and we present them with great opportunities to work on some of the best Shopify brands (Alo Yoga, Chubbies, JUDY & many many more).

translations.ja: ネットワークに採用された開発者はフリーランスとして働き、最高のShopifyブランド（Alo Yoga、Chubbies、JUDYなど多数）との仕事の機会を提供します。

segments.source_content: The great thing about Storetasker is that devs aren't in competition with each other - they just pick up the jobs that match their interests. Beyond that - it's a very tight-knit community.

translations.ja: Storetaskerの素晴らしい点は、開発者が互いに競争するのではなく、自分の興味に合った仕事を選べることです。それ以上に、非常に緊密なコミュニティです。

segments.source_content: Feel free to apply directly via this [link](https://www.storetasker.com/become-an-expert?utm_campaign=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=thisweekinreact\&utm_source=thisweekinreact) to join.

translations.ja: こちらの[リンク](https://www.storetasker.com/become-an-expert?utm_campaign=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=thisweekinreact\&utm_source=thisweekinreact)から直接応募してください。

segments.source_content: [**TechTree - Introducing This Week in React Bounty Board**](https://techtree.dev/t/sHBrozirH3xSY8jP3M7gGv?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [**TechTree - This Week in Reactバウンティボードの紹介**](https://techtree.dev/t/sHBrozirH3xSY8jP3M7gGv?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: TechTree is building the first **social-economic platform for developers** - a place to help you unlock the real value of your knowledge and network!

translations.ja: TechTreeは、開発者のための初の**ソーシャルエコノミックプラットフォーム**を構築中です。あなたの知識とネットワークの真の価値を引き出す場所です！

segments.source_content: The first major feature on TechTree is Bounties, a tool to help you **earn money by referring your friends** to open roles at top VC backed tech startups or find a job that might be right for you!

translations.ja: TechTreeの最初の主要機能はバウンティです。これは、トップVC支援のテックスタートアップの空きポジションに友人を紹介してお金を稼いだり、自分に合った仕事を見つけたりするためのツールです！

segments.source_content: To help show you around, I have gone ahead and created my very own Bounty board - **a selection of remote, React related roles for you to apply to or refer your network to**. There has been over \$300k worth of Bounties claimed on TechTree so far!

translations.ja: ご案内のために、私自身のバウンティボードを作成しました。これは、リモートのReact関連の職種を応募または紹介するための選択肢です。TechTreeではこれまでに30万ドル以上のバウンティが請求されています！

segments.source_content: Looking to hire React developers? You can post Bounties of your own to be featured on my Bounty board! Read more and get started [here](https://www.notion.so/techtreedev/Share-your-jobs-on-my-Bounty-board-c51d2d97d9f3421bab103c42097907ae?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

translations.ja: React開発者を採用したいですか？自分のバウンティを投稿して私のバウンティボードに掲載することができます！詳細は[こちら](https://www.notion.so/techtreedev/Share-your-jobs-on-my-Bounty-board-c51d2d97d9f3421bab103c42097907ae?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)からご覧ください。

segments.source_content: ## React-Native

translations.ja: ## React-Native

segments.source_content: [**Announcing React Native 0.69**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/06/21/version-069?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja: [**React Native 0.69の発表**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/06/21/version-069?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: First version of React-Native to support React 18. To use the new features of Concurrent React, you will have to migrate to the new architecture first. The Hermes distribution mode has also changed: each version of React-Native will be associated with a Hermes version guaranteed compatible.

translations.ja: React 18をサポートする最初のReact-Nativeバージョンです。Concurrent Reactの新機能を使用するには、まず新しいアーキテクチャに移行する必要があります。Hermesの配布モードも変更されました。React-Nativeの各バージョンには、互換性が保証されたHermesバージョンが関連付けられます。

segments.source_content: **Extras:**

* 📦 [react-native-zephyr](https://github.com/FormidableLabs/react-native-zephyr?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Formidable Labs published a new React-Native type-safe styling solution inspired by Tailwind. Focusing on mobile usage, not [cross-platform](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1541820495603064832?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) for now.
* 📦 [react-native-app-clip](https://github.com/bndkt/react-native-app-clip?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Expo config plugin to create an iOS App Clip, permitting to users to test your app without even installing it ([demo](https://twitter.com/bndkt/status/1539606675291639808?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)).
* 📦 [react-native-safari-extension](https://github.com/andrew-levy/react-native-safari-extension?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* 📦 [link-native-assets-expo-config-plugin](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1539885820622110720?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* 🎙️ [RNR 240 - What's New in Expo SDK 45](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-240-whats-new-in-expo-sdk-45?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* 📈 [React-Native vs Flutter popularity](https://gist.github.com/tkrotoff/93f5278a4e8df7e5f6928eff98684979?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* 🐦 [Reanimated useAnimatedSensor() demo](https://twitter.com/swmansion/status/1541433419107733505?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* 🎉 [Reanimated PR: reduce bundle size on Web by 80%](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/pull/3278?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja:
* 📦 [react-native-zephyr](https://github.com/FormidableLabs/react-native-zephyr?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Formidable Labsが、Tailwindにインスパイアされた型安全なReact-Nativeスタイリングソリューションを公開。現在はモバイル利用に焦点を当てており、[クロスプラットフォーム](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1541820495603064832?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)対応はまだ未対応。
* 📦 [react-native-app-clip](https://github.com/bndkt/react-native-app-clip?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): iOS App Clipを作成するExpo設定プラグイン。ユーザーがアプリをインストールせずに試用できるようにする（[デモ](https://twitter.com/bndkt/status/1539606675291639808?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)）。

segments.source_content: ## Other

translations.ja: ## その他

segments.source_content:
* [ES2022 Features](https://h3manth.com/ES2022/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Ecma International just validated the ES2022 spec. Overview of all the features included: `.at()`, Error Cause, top-level await...
* [Defensive CSS](https://defensivecss.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): CSS tips to make your CSS more robust.
* [Style Queries](https://una.im/style-queries/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): CSS Container Queries is not just about layouts.
* [StackOverflow Developer Survey 2022](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2022/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): React remains very used and liked. Svelte and Phoenix are good challengers.
* [Histoire: A new way to write stories](https://histoire.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Storybook challenger coming from the Vue ecosystem.
* [FnApi](https://twitter.com/kdy1dev/status/1540673590282326018?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): new project from Donny (swc creator) to reduce API calls boilerplate
* [Prisma 4.0](https://twitter.com/prisma/status/1541866761552908289?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* [Turborepo 1.3](https://turborepo.org/blog/turbo-1-3-0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
* [SPAs: theory versus practice](https://nolanlawson.com/2022/06/27/spas-theory-versus-practice/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.ja:
